# alicloud\_ecs\_auto\_snapshot\_policy\_attachment

Provides a ECS Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment resource.

For information about ECS Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment and how to use it, see [What is Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/doc-detail/25531.htm).

-> **NOTE:** Available in v1.122.0+.

## Example Usage

Basic Usage

```python
import constructs as constructs
import cdktf as cdktf
# Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
# See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.
import ...gen.providers.alicloud as alicloud
class MyConvertedCode(cdktf.TerraformStack):
    def __init__(self, scope, name):
        super().__init__(scope, name)
        alicloud_ecs_auto_snapshot_policy_example =
        alicloud.ecs_auto_snapshot_policy.EcsAutoSnapshotPolicy(self, "example",
            name="terraform-example",
            repeat_weekdays=["1", "2", "3"],
            retention_days=cdktf.Token.as_number(cdktf.Op.negate(1)),
            time_points=["1", "22", "23"]
        )
        alicloud_kms_key_example = alicloud.kms_key.KmsKey(self, "example_1",
            description="terraform-example",
            pending_window_in_days=cdktf.Token.as_number("7"),
            status="Enabled"
        )
        # This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.
        alicloud_kms_key_example.override_logical_id("example")
        data_alicloud_zones_example =
        alicloud.data_alicloud_zones.DataAlicloudZones(self, "example_2",
            available_resource_creation="VSwitch"
        )
        # This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.
        data_alicloud_zones_example.override_logical_id("example")
        alicloud_ecs_disk_example = alicloud.ecs_disk.EcsDisk(self, "example_3",
            category="cloud_efficiency",
            description="Hello ecs disk.",
            disk_name="terraform-example",
            encrypted=True,
            kms_key_id=cdktf.Token.as_string(alicloud_kms_key_example.id),
            size=cdktf.Token.as_number("30"),
            tags={
                "Name": "terraform-example"
            },
            zone_id=cdktf.Token.as_string(
                cdktf.property_access(data_alicloud_zones_example.zones, ["0", "id"]))
        )
        # This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.
        alicloud_ecs_disk_example.override_logical_id("example")
        alicloud_ecs_auto_snapshot_policy_attachment_example =
        alicloud.ecs_auto_snapshot_policy_attachment.EcsAutoSnapshotPolicyAttachment(self, "example_4",
            auto_snapshot_policy_id=cdktf.Token.as_string(alicloud_ecs_auto_snapshot_policy_example.id),
            disk_id=cdktf.Token.as_string(alicloud_ecs_disk_example.id)
        )
        # This allows the Terraform resource name to match the original name. You can remove the call if you don't need them to match.
        alicloud_ecs_auto_snapshot_policy_attachment_example.override_logical_id("example")
```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `auto_snapshot_policy_id` - (Required, ForceNew) The auto snapshot policy id.
* `disk_id` - (Required, ForceNew) The disk id.

## Attributes Reference

The following attributes are exported:

* `id` - The resource ID of Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment. The value is formatted `<auto_snapshot_policy_id>:<disk_id>`.

## Import

ECS Auto Snapshot Policy Attachment can be imported using the id, e.g.

```shell
$ terraform import alicloud_ecs_auto_snapshot_policy_attachment.example s-abcd12345:d-abcd12345
```
